title: Foundation: A/Ls and Strong Language Skills
description: A degree is not always mandatory but highly recommended. A BA in Mass Communication, English, or Social Sciences is ideal. What's non-negotiable are excellent writing and communication skills in English, Sinhala, or Tamil.

title: Internship and Building a Portfolio
description: Gain practical experience by interning at a newspaper, TV station, or online news outlet. Focus on getting bylines (your name on published articles). This portfolio of work is more important than your academic qualifications when looking for your first job.
qualifications: A portfolio of published work (even on a blog)

title: Junior Reporter / Journalist
description: Work as a full-time reporter. You will be assigned a 'beat' (a specific area to cover, like politics, business, or sports). Your job is to find news stories, interview sources, and write accurate and timely articles.
institutes: All major media houses in Sri Lanka

title: Senior Reporter / Feature Writer
description: As a senior reporter, you will cover more significant stories and conduct in-depth investigations. You might also move into feature writing, creating longer, more narrative-driven articles. You will be a trusted name in your field.
qualifications: A strong reputation for accuracy and integrity
institutes: Leading newspapers and digital media outlets

title: Editor / News Manager
description: Advance to an editorial role, where you move from creating content to managing it. Editors are responsible for assigning stories, editing copy, ensuring quality and accuracy, and shaping the overall editorial direction of the publication.
